root: ^It’s the end of the day, and you contemplate the strange assortment of tasks you’ve potentially agreed to.
^Taking on an unpaid second job, doing menial shopping and research tasks for someone else… It suddenly feels as if you might be a personal assistant, and not a receptionist.
^Despite your choices, you feel like something has been lurking just out of your vision, scrutinizing every word you’ve said.
^You can’t see anything as hands obscure your eyes. They are unnaturally cold.
^Dread coils in your stomach, and you can’t tell if it's nerves, or just an unfortunate side effect of your Boss being the Hat Man.
^“A little bird told me that my receptionist has been spending too much time helping other creatures with their unnecessary problems.”
^So, he’s found you out. Your idle attempts at socialisation have gotten you into hot water.
^This wouldn’t be the first time, but something feels different, more hostile.
^“I don’t think you will be here tomorrow.”
